title: How to Change Valve Cover Gaskets

steps.title: Pull all wires and vacuum hoses away from the valve cover top.
steps.content: Pull all wires and vacuum hoses away from the valve cover top. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Make sure to remember where all of the hoses and vacuum hoses were connected.
steps.content: Make sure to remember where all of the hoses and vacuum hoses were connected. Some people like to snap a picture before they disconnect the wires and hoses.

steps.title: Unbolt the bolts that hold the valve cover down with a 1⁄4 inch (0.6 cm) drive ratchet.
steps.content: Unbolt the bolts that hold the valve cover down with a 1 ⁄ 4 inch (0.6 cm) drive ratchet.

steps.title: Lift the valve cover carefully to contain debris from falling into valves and springs.
steps.content: Lift the valve cover carefully to contain debris from falling into valves and springs. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Pull off old gasket and clean the valve cover in degreaser or hot soapy water.
steps.content: Pull off old gasket and clean the valve cover in degreaser or hot soapy water. [3] X Research source You could use a wire brush and a 5 gallon (18.9 L) bucket.

steps.title: Use a dab and a permatex every 6 inches (15.2 cm) on the valve cover groove.
steps.content: Use a dab and a permatex every 6 inches (15.2 cm) on the valve cover groove. [4] X Research source Gently seat the new gasket in its groove and let it sit for about 10 minutes.

steps.title: Gently move the valve cover back in position.
steps.content: Gently move the valve cover back in position. Tighten the bolts that hold the valve cover down to the torque specification [5] X Research source .

steps.title: Reconnect all the hoses and wires that were disconnected.
steps.content: Reconnect all the hoses and wires that were disconnected.
